trans-unit.note: Used as the name on a tab of the Accessibility Checks screen.

trans-unit.source: Bloom can automatically check these for you:

trans-unit.note: Used as the name on a tab of the Accessibility Checks screen.
Used as the name on a tab of the Accessibility Checks screen.

trans-unit.source: "Accessible Books" are books that work well for people with impaired vision. With the ePUB format*, it is possible to make "Born Accessible" books that work well for everyone**, regardless of vision. Bloom has the following tools to help you create these books:
trans-unit.note: The * and ** are footnote markers that should remain the same.

trans-unit.source: This tool, the Accessibility Checker, has:
The "Accessibility Checklist" which is where Bloom checks over your book and points you to anything that needs attention, especially for speakers of minority languages.
The "Ace by Daisy Checker" searches the actual ePUB generated by Bloom looking for any problems.

While the ideal is that a single book can serve everyone, the ePUB standard and ePUB readers do not actually support that. They currently only work for blind people who speak a language that is supported by "Text to Speech" (TTS) systems. At this time, TTS is only available for large or commercially interesting languages. Until the standard and accessible readers improve, it is necessary to make special versions of accessible books for minority language speakers. For blind readers to hear the image descriptions, we need to put something special on the page. In this version of Bloom, you do this by clicking the "Include image descriptions on page" checkbox in the Publish:ePUB screen. Future versions may have other options in this area.
You need to check these yourself:

Possibly this is an old Bloom Pack created before Bloom Packs could handle special characters in file names. You may be able to get the author to re-create it using a current version. If that's not possible a technical expert may be able to repair things.
The {0} Collection is now ready to use on this computer.

trans-unit.note: Displayed as the message box title

trans-unit.source: This BloomPack appears to be incomplete or corrupt.
Bloom was not able to install that Bloom Pack

trans-unit.note: Shown while Bloom Packs are being installed

trans-unit.source: Bloom is already running, but the contents will not show up until the next time you run Bloom
The Bloom collection will not be installed.
This computer already has a Bloom collection named '{0}'. Do you want to replace it with the one from this Bloom Pack?
Bloom Packs should have only a single collection folder at the top level of the .ZIP file.
Bloom was not able to remove the existing copy of '{0}'. Quit Bloom if it is running & try again. Otherwise, try again after restarting your computer.
To select, use your mouse wheel or point at what you want, or press the key shown in purple. Finally, release the key that you pressed to show this list.
trans-unit.note: When you hold down a key, a popup appears that lets you choose a related character. These instructions are shown in that popup.
OLD TEXT (before 3.9): To select, use your mouse wheel or point at what you want, then release the key.

trans-unit.source: This formatting is the default for all text boxes with '{0}' style.
This formatting is for all text boxes with '{0}' style.
This formatting is for all {0} text boxes with '{1}' style.
Sorry, Reader Templates do not allow changes to formatting.

trans-unit.note: indicates that no level of accessibility conformance is claimed
minimal question indicating a link to information

trans-unit.source: Bloom had a problem reading this book and recovered by restoring a recent backup. Please check recent changes to this book. If this happens for no obvious reason, please click Details below and report it to us.

It appears that some part of the folder path to this book has been moved or renamed. As a result, Bloom cannot save your changes to this page, and will need to exit now. If you haven't been renaming or moving things, please click Details below and report the problem to the developers.
Open Page in Firefox (which must be in the PATH environment variable)
There was a problem while saving. Please return to the previous page and make sure it looks correct.

trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9): Show Experimental Commands (e.g. Export XML for InDesign)

trans-unit.source: Bloom is switching the default font for "{0}" to the new "Andika New Basic".
This will improve the printed output for most languages. If your language is one of the few that need "Andika", you can switch it back in Settings:Book Making.

trans-unit.note: Used in 3.9 and 4.0; not used in 4.1
Name of a Front/Back Matter Pack used for Bloom Reader
Name of a Front/Back Matter Pack that puts credits on the inside of the front cover
Name of a Front/Back Matter Pack that has SIL Papua New Guinea customizations
Name of a Front/Back Matter Pack that puts title page on the inside of the front cover and credits on the inside of the back cover
Name of the default Front/Back Matter Pack
Name of a Front/Back Matter Pack that is used for talking/animating experiences
In a local language collection, we say 'Local Language', but in a source collection, Local Language has no relevance, so we use this different label
In a local language collection, we say 'Language 2 (e.g. National Language)', but in a source collection, National Language has no relevance, so we use this different label
In a local language collection, we say 'Language 3 (e.g. Regional Language)', but in a source collection, National Language has no relevance, so we use this different label
If there is no third language specified, the link changes to this.
OLD TEXT (before 3.9, 1 fewer space): Language 3 (e.g. Regional Language) (Optional)
If you make certain changes in the settings dialog, the OK button changes to this.

trans-unit.source: Bloom will close and re-open this project with the new settings.
Your system administrator manages Bloom updates for this computer.
Get more source books at BloomLibrary.org
trans-unit.note: Shown at the bottom of the list of books. User can click on it and it will attempt to open a browser to show the Bloom Library

trans-unit.source: Note: The Bloom Library contains shell books, whereas your current collection is a "source collection", meaning it is for making shell books, not for translating them into the local language.
trans-unit.note: get this clicking on BloomLibrary.org link in source collection

trans-unit.source: When you've made a shell, you can then upload it to the Bloom Library from the Publish tab.
trans-unit.note: get this clicking on BloomLibrary.org link in source collection
get this clicking on BloomLibrary.org link in source collection

trans-unit.source: Bloom will now open this HTML document in your word processing program (normally Word or LibreOffice). You will be able to work with the text and images of this book. These programs normally don't do well with preserving the layout, so don't expect much.
This collection is locked, so new books cannot be added/removed.

Because this is a source collection, Bloom isn't offering any existing shells as sources for new shells. If you want to add a language to a shell, instead you need to edit the collection containing the shell, rather than making a copy of it. Also, the Wall Calendar currently can't be used to make a new Shell.
Make a book using this source
Create a book in my language using this source book

trans-unit.note: used in 3.9 and earlier; feature removed in 4.0
This is the button you use to create a new collection, open a new one, or get one from a repository somewhere.
This is the button you use to create a new collection, open a new one, or get one from a repository somewhere.
Restart the Bloom program, not Windows
Shown as the thumbnail caption when the book doesn't have a title.
Shown when hovering over an item in the UI Language menu. The {0} marker is filled in by a number between 1 and 100.

trans-unit.source: Could not connect to the server to check for an update. Are you connected to the internet?

trans-unit.source: Your Bloom is up to date.
Bloom is already working on checking for updates.
A new version appears to be available, but Bloom could not install it.

trans-unit.note: Appears after Bloom has downloaded a program update in the background and is ready to switch the user to it the next time they run Bloom.

trans-unit.source: A new version of Bloom is available.

Used for the Finish button in wizards, like that used for making a New Collection
Used as a label for additional information, like duration etc in the Sign Language Tool
This is shown when Bloom is slowly loading something, so the user doesn't worry about why they don't see the result immediately.
Used for the Next button in wizards, like that used for making a New Collection
In a wizard, this button takes you to the next step.
Used to point the user to a web page. Put the '{0}' where the web page URL will go.

When you make a book from a shell, use this box to tell who did the translation.

trans-unit.source: Acknowledgments for this version, in {lang}. For example, give credit to the translator for this version.

International Standard Book Number. Leave blank if you don't have one of these.

trans-unit.note: The {0} is replaced by the filename of an image. The {1} is replaced by a reference to the first page in the book where that image occurs.

trans-unit.source: If you need somewhere to put more information about the book, you can use this page, which is the inside of the front cover.

trans-unit.note: This is used to separate items in a list, such as 'Province, District, Country' on the Title Page. For English, that means comma followed by a space. Don't forget the space if your script uses them.

trans-unit.source: Something to tell the reader/viewer that this is the end of the book.
Something to tell the reader/viewer that this is the end.

trans-unit.note: Used on the Title page of a book when "Paste Image Credits" is clicked. Put {0} in the translation where the list of page numbers should go and put {1} in the translation where the image credits should go. For example in English, 'Images on pages {0} by {1}.' comes out like 'Images on pages 1, 2, and 4 by John Doe, Copyright John Doe 2017, CC-BY-NC.'
OLD TEXT (early 4.1, remove quotation marks): "Images on pages {0} by {1}."

trans-unit.source: The contributions made by writers, illustrators, editors, etc., in {lang}

trans-unit.note: On the Credits page of a book being translated, Bloom shows the original copyright. Put {0} in the translation where the copyright notice should go. For example in English, 'Adapted from original, {0}.' comes out like 'Adapted from original, Copyright 2011 SIL'.

trans-unit.source: Adapted from original without a copyright notice.
trans-unit.note: On the Credits page of a book being translated, Bloom shows this if the original book did not have a copyright notice.

On the Credits page of a book being translated, Bloom puts texts like 'Licensed under CC-BY', so that we have a record of what the license was for the original book. Put {0} in the translation, where the license should go in the sentence.

trans-unit.source: Simple line drawings look best. Instead of using this page, you can also make your own thumbnail.png file and set it to Read-only so Bloom doesn't write over it.

trans-unit.note: Used on the Title page of a book when "Paste Image Credits" is clicked. Put {0} in the translation where the page number of an image should go and put {1} in the translation where the image credits should go. For example in English, 'Image on page {0} by {1}.' comes out like 'Image on page 3 by John Doe, Copyright John Doe 2017, CC-BY-NC.'
OLD TEXT (early 4.1, remove quotation marks): "Image on page {0} by {1}."

trans-unit.source: Image is missing information on Credits, Copyright, or License
Try closing other programs and restart your computer if necessary.
Feel free to modify or delete this page.

The file youve chosen is a JPEG file. JPEG files are perfect for photographs and color artwork. However, JPEG files are a big problem for black and white line art. Problems include:
 Fuzziness and grey dots.
 Large file sizes, making the book hard to share.
 If there are many large JPEGs, Bloom may not have enough memory to make PDF files.

Note: Because JPEG is lossy, converting a JPEG to PNG, TIFF, or BMP actually makes things even worse. If this is black and white line art, you want to get an original scan in one of those formats.

Please select from one of the following, then click OK:
This option is only available in the Publish tab.

trans-unit.note: Button that tells Bloom to re-lock a shell book so it can't be modified (other than translation).

trans-unit.source: Books are never locked in a Source Collection.

trans-unit.note: This shows up in pages like the cover where sizing is very flexible. No one thing is too big, but not everything on the page will fit. To see it, put a lot of text on a cover page, until a red bar appears at the bottom; then hover over the bar.

trans-unit.source: That change is not allowed. Front matter and back matter pages must remain where they are.
Choose a page size and orientation
There is nothing on the Clipboard that you can paste here.
You cannot put anything in there while making an original book.

trans-unit.source: Include the name of the language using {lang}. For example: "Enter color in {lang}".
trans-unit.note: Becomes visible when "Show on each" option is chosen in combo. Do NOT translate {lang}.

trans-unit.source: "Normal" will show local language, and potentially regional or national, depending on the multilingual settings of the book. Use this for most content.
Use one of these for simple text boxes that are always in only one language.

trans-unit.note: Label above pull-down menu with options, ShowOnGroup/ShowOnEach

trans-unit.source: On each language-field in the group
Just once on the whole group

trans-unit.note: Label above the set of options, Top/Center/Bottom

trans-unit.source: What should authors put in this box?
You can use these check boxes to have Bloom simulate how your images would look with various visual impairments.

Motion Books are Bloom Reader books with two modes. Normally, they are Talking Books. When you turn the phone sideways, the picture fills the screen. It pans and zooms from rectangle "1" to rectangle "2".

trans-unit.note: The label of a checkbox indicating whether motion is included in Preview (currently it always is, so the box is always checked)
The label of a checkbox indicating whether background music is played during Preview.
The label of a checkbox controlling whether voice narration plays during Preview.
Used as the overall title of the toolbox panel

trans-unit.source: You can set up background music to play with this page when the book is viewed in the Bloom Reader app.

Used to create string "Level # of #". The spaces on each side of this word are added programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Bloom normally prevents most changes to shellbooks. If you need to add pages, change images, etc., tick the box below.

trans-unit.source: Here is what your camera sees:

trans-unit.note: This is very low priority for translation.

trans-unit.source: This computer appears to have no sound recording device available. You will need one to record audio for a talking book.
Please hold the button down until you have finished recording

trans-unit.source: 1) Check that you are recording into the correct device and that these levels are showing blue:
Please clear all existing recordings on this page before changing modes.
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool, make a recording, and then attempt to toggle the "Record by Sentences" input (without first clearing the audio recordings you are about to lose)

trans-unit.source: Make an e-book that can play audio recordings while highlighting text.

trans-unit.note: Shown in edit tab multilingualism chooser, for trilingual mode, 3 languages per page

trans-unit.source: This book is in translate-only mode. If you want to make other changes, click this to temporarily unlock the book.
trans-unit.note: Button that tells Bloom to temporarily unlock a shell book for editing other than translation.

trans-unit.source: Bloom had a problem showing this book. This doesn't mean your work is lost, but it does mean that something is out of date, is missing, or has gone wrong.

trans-unit.note: displays as a "toast", {0} is the URL/filename

trans-unit.source: Bloom was unable to start its own HTTP listener that it uses to talk to its embedded Firefox browser. If this happens even if you just restarted your computer, then ask someone to investigate if you have an aggressive firewall product installed, which may need to be uninstalled before you can use Bloom.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, shorter wording): Bloom was unable to start its own HTTP listener that it uses to talk to its embedded Firefox browser. If this happens even if you just restarted your computer, ask someone to investigate if you have an aggressive firewall product installed. The agressive firewall product may need to be uninstalled before you can use Bloom.

trans-unit.source: Bloom had trouble saving a page. Please click Details below and report this to us. Then quit Bloom, run it again, and check to see if the page you just edited is missing anything. Sorry!

trans-unit.note: The placeholder {0} represents the current version of Bloom. For example, {0} might be replaced with "4.3"

trans-unit.source: This might be caused by Windows Defender "Controlled Folder Access" or some other virus protection.
trans-unit.note: After an October 2017 windows update, this appears when Bloom opens a collection and tries to write out the collection settings.

trans-unit.source: This program cannot write to the folder {0}.
trans-unit.note: This only happens on Windows after an October 2017 update, {0} is the folder that Bloom failed to write to.

trans-unit.source: Your computer denied Bloom access to the book. You may need technical help in setting the operating system permissions for this file.
Upgrade to the latest Bloom (requires Internet connection)
trans-unit.note: This is a link that will take them to the Downloads (Installers) web page

trans-unit.source: There was a problem selecting the book. Restarting Bloom may fix the problem. If not, please click the 'Details' button and report the problem to the Bloom Developers.

trans-unit.source: There was a problem updating the book. Restarting Bloom may fix the problem. If not, please click the 'Details' button and report the problem to the Bloom Developers.

This Book called for Front/Back Matter pack named '{0}', but Bloom couldn't find that on this computer. You can either install a Bloom Pack that will give you '{0}', or change the book's Front/Back Matter pack setting.
trans-unit.note: Not found in version 3.9 or later)

trans-unit.source: This Collection called for Front/Back Matter pack named '{0}', but this version of Bloom does not have it, and Bloom could not find it on this computer. The collection has been changed to use the default Front/Back Matter pages.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, reworded): This Book called for Front/Back Matter pack named '{0}', but Bloom couldn't find that on this computer. You can either install a Bloom Pack that will give you '{0}', or go to Settings:Book Making and change to another Front/Back Matter Pack.
This shows in the 'toast' that pops up to notify the user of a non-fatal problem.

trans-unit.source: This book called for a Front/Back Matter pack named '{0}', but this version of Bloom does not have it, and Bloom could not find it on this computer. The book has been changed to use the Front/Back Matter pages from the Collection Settings.

Bloom cannot start properly, and this symptom has been observed on machines with ZoneAlarm installed. Note: disabling ZoneAlarm does not help. Nor does restarting with it turned off. Something about the installation of ZoneAlarm causes the problem, and so far only uninstalling ZoneAlarm has been shown to fix the problem.

trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, added dots): About Bloom
OLD TEXT (before 3.9, shortened): Request a Feature (web)

trans-unit.source: A component of Bloom, BloomPdfMaker.exe, seems to be missing. This prevents previews and printing. Antivirus software sometimes does this. You may need technical help to repair the Bloom installation and protect this file from being deleted again.

trans-unit.note: short message for a popup toast notification

trans-unit.source: Bloom could not replace an mp3 file. If this continues, check your antivirus.
trans-unit.note: longer message for a detailed description of the problem
OLD TEXT (before 3.9, added space): Converting to mp3

trans-unit.source: This script is right to left
I accept the terms of the license agreement
I agree to the Bloom Library's Terms of Use
There is already a collection with that name, at {0}.\nPlease pick a unique name.
Choose the main language for this collection.
What would you like to call this collection?
OK, that's all we need to get started with your new '{0}' collection.\nClick on the 'Finish' button.
trans-unit.note: {0} is the name of the new collection

trans-unit.source: If you already have a collection you want to open, click the 'Cancel' button.

A collection of shell or template books in one or more languages of wider communication. You will be able to upload these shells to BloomLibrary.org. You may also make a Bloom Pack to give to others so that they can make local language books with your shells.
A collection of books in a local language.
These are optional. Bloom will place them in the right places on title page of books you create.

trans-unit.note: The {0} is replaced by the name of the language.

trans-unit.source: Unable to create a new collection using that name.
You are almost ready to start making books.
In order to keep things simple and organized, Bloom keeps all the books you make in one or more Collections. The first thing we need to do is make one for you.

Bloom detected that this collection is located in your Dropbox folder. This can cause problems as Dropbox sometimes locks Bloom out of its own files. If you have problems, we recommend that you move your collection somewhere else or disable Dropbox while using Bloom.
This collection is part of your 'Sources for new books' which you can see in the bottom left of the Collections tab. It cannot be opened for editing.

trans-unit.note: This shows in the file-open dialog that you use to open a different bloom collection

trans-unit.source: Browse for another collection on this computer
Copy From Chorus Hub on Local Network

trans-unit.note: This opens the Chorus Help to learn more about send/receive.

trans-unit.source: Has someone else used Send/Receive to share a collection with you?\nUse one of these red buttons to copy their collection to your computer.\nLater, use Send/Receive to share your work back with them.
Pages can not be re-ordered when you are translating a book.
Please install Adobe Reader so that Bloom can show your completed book. Until then, you can still save the PDF Book and open it in some other program.
That's strange... Adobe Reader gave an error when trying to show that PDF. You can still try saving the PDF Book.

Sad News. Bloom wasn't able to get Adobe Reader to show here, so Bloom can't show your completed book.\nPlease uninstall your existing version of 'Adobe Reader' and (re)install 'Adobe Reader'.\nUntil you get that fixed, you can still save the PDF Book and open it in some other program.

trans-unit.note: Help link under Motion Book checkbox
This is the heading above various buttons that control the publishing of the book to Android.

trans-unit.source: Here you can send your book to the Bloom Reader Android app.
trans-unit.note: This is displayed at the top of the Android screen.

trans-unit.source: Checking {0} font: License OK for embedding.
Embedding font {0} at a cost of {1} megs
trans-unit.note: {1} is a number with one decimal place, the number of megabytes the font file takes up

trans-unit.source: Checking {0} font: License does not permit embedding.
Checking {0} font: No font found to embed.
Packaging "{0}" for use with Bloom Reader...

trans-unit.note: Link to find Bloom Reader on Google Play Store
A heading in the Publish to Android screen.
There are several methods for pushing a book to android. This is the heading above the chooser.

trans-unit.source: You can now read "{0}" in Bloom Reader!

trans-unit.note: {0} is a the name of the device Bloom connected to

trans-unit.source: The device reported that it does not have enough space for this book. The book is {0} MB.
trans-unit.note: {0} is the size of the book that Bloom is trying to copy over to the Android device.

trans-unit.source: The following devices are connected but do not seem to have Bloom Reader running:
An error occurred and the book was not sent to your Android device.
Looking for an Android device connected by USB cable and set up for MTP...
trans-unit.note: This is a progress message; MTP is an acronym for the system that allows computers to access files on devices.

trans-unit.source: The following connected devices all have Bloom Reader installed. Please connect only one of these devices.
Packaging "{0}" for use with Bloom Reader...
Unable to connect to any Android device which has Bloom Reader.

trans-unit.note: Button that tells Bloom to send the book to a device via USB cable.

trans-unit.source: Got a book request we could not process. Possibly the device is running an incompatible version of BloomReader?
Sending the book failed. Possibly the device was disconnected? If you can't see a reason for this the following may be helpful to report to the developers:

trans-unit.note: {0} is the name of the book, {1} is the name of the device
{0} is the name of the book, {1} is the name of the device

trans-unit.source: On the Android, run Bloom Reader, open the menu and choose 'Receive Books from computer'.
You can do this on as many devices as you like. Make sure each device is connected to the same network as this computer.
Advertising book to Bloom Readers on local network...

trans-unit.note: Button that tells Bloom to begin offering this book on the wifi network.
Button that tells Bloom to stop offering this book on the wifi network.

trans-unit.source: The layout of this book is currently "{0}". Bloom Reader will display it using "{1}", so text might not fit. To see if anything needs adjusting, go back to the Edit Tab and change the layout to "{1}".

trans-unit.note: This is shown in the 'Save' dialog when you save a bloom book in the format that works with the Bloom Reader Android App

trans-unit.source: Make a booklet from the inside pages of the book.\nPages will be laid out and reordered so that when you fold it, you'll have a booklet.\n
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, add newline): Make a booklet from the inside pages of the book. Pages will be laid out and reordered so that when you fold it, you'll have a booklet.\n
This link opens a dialog box that lets you put in information someone (often a librarian) might use to search for a book with particular characteristics.

trans-unit.source: Upload to BloomLibrary.org, where others can download and localize into their own language.
Make a PDF of just the front and back (both sides), so you can print on colored paper.

trans-unit.note: Here, the English 'Accessibility' is a common way of refering to technologies that are usable by people with disabilities. With computers, this usually means people with visual impairments. It includes botht he blind and people who might need text to be larger, or who are colorblind, etc.
label for the book content in the ePUB's Table of Contents

trans-unit.source: Make an ePUB (electronic book) out of this book, allowing it to be read on various electronic reading devices.

trans-unit.note: This is the title of a dialog about exporting a Bloom book to the InDesign XML format
The parenthesized word indicates the negative effect of using this option. This text is for a menu item.

trans-unit.source: Bloom cannot make booklets using the current page size.
trans-unit.note: If a book has a paper size that is too big (like A4), Bloom does not know how to make booklets with it. So the controls for booklets get disabled and this message is shown.

trans-unit.source: This PDF viewer can be improved by installing the free Adobe Reader on this computer.

trans-unit.note: Instead of making a booklet, just make normal pages

trans-unit.source: Make a PDF of every page of the book, one page per piece of paper.
Open the PDF in the default system PDF viewer

trans-unit.note: menu header in the Publish tab
Header for a region of the menu which lists various standard page layout sizes

trans-unit.source: Choose a page size and orientation
trans-unit.note: menu header in the Publish tab

trans-unit.source: Bloom had a problem making a PDF of this book. You may need technical help or to contact the developers. But here are some things you can try:

trans-unit.note: Message displayed in a progress report dialog box

trans-unit.source: Compressing PDF & Converting Color to CMYK
trans-unit.note: Message displayed in a progress report dialog box
Message displayed in a progress report dialog box
OLD TEXT (before 4.0, removed space): Creating PDF ...

trans-unit.source: Error creating, compressing, or recoloring the PDF file
trans-unit.note: Message briefly displayed to the user in a toast

trans-unit.source: Error compressing or recoloring the PDF file
trans-unit.note: Message briefly displayed to the user in a toast
Message displayed in a progress report dialog box
Message displayed in a progress report dialog box
Message displayed in a progress report dialog box, {0} is replaced by the page number

trans-unit.source: PDF with CMYK color (U.S. Web Coated (SWOP) v2)
trans-unit.note: displayed as file type for Save File dialog, the content in parentheses may not be translatable. 'CMYK' may not be translatable, it is a print shop standard.
displayed as file type for Save File dialog. 'RGB' may not be translatable, it is a standard.
Message displayed in a progress report dialog box

trans-unit.source: Try doing this on a computer with more memory
Restart your computer and try this again right away
Replace large, high-resolution images in your document with lower-resolution ones
The PDF file has not been saved because you chose not to allow producing a "PDF for Printshop".
trans-unit.note: explanation that file was not saved displayed in a message box

trans-unit.source: Bloom uses Adobe color profiles to convert PDF files from using RGB color to using CMYK color. This is part of preparing a "PDF for Printshop". You must agree to the following license in order to perform this task in Bloom.
trans-unit.note: Brief explanation of what this license is and why the user needs to agree to it
Button that tells Bloom to save the book in the current format.

trans-unit.source: All rights reserved (Contact the Copyright holder for any permissions.)
BloomLibrary.org already has a previous version of this book from you. If you upload it again, it will be replaced with your current version.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, added space): BloomLibrary.org already has a previous version of this book from you. If you upload it again, it will be replaced with your current version.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, there was a problem uploading {0}. Some details follow. You may need technical help.
One or more fields above need your attention before uploading.

Sorry, "{0}" was not successfully uploaded. Sometimes this is caused by temporary problems with the servers we use. It's worth trying again in an hour or two. If you regularly get this problem please report it to us.
By uploading, you confirm your agreement with the Bloom Library Terms of Use and grant the rights it describes.
There was a problem uploading your book.
In the Bloom community, we help each other by sharing both new and newly translated books on the Bloom Library.

trans-unit.note: This is added after the language name, in order to indicate that some parts of the book have not been translated into this language yet.

trans-unit.source: We cannot sign you up with that address, because we already have an account with that address. Would you like to log in instead?
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, added space): We cannot sign you up with that address, because we already have an account with that address. Would you like to log in instead?

trans-unit.source: Bloom could not connect to the server to verify your login. Please check your network connection.
Bloom could not connect to the server to complete your login or signup. This could be a problem with your internet connection, our server, or some equipment in between.
In order to sign up for a BloomLibrary.org account, you must check the box indicating that you agree to the BloomLibrary Terms of Use.
We don't have a user on record with that email. Would you like to sign up?
Password and user ID did not match
Please agree to terms of use
Please enter a valid email address. We will send an email to this address so you can reset your password.
Bloom could not connect to the server to reset your password. Please check your network connection.
We are sending an email to {0} with instructions for how to reset your password.
Bloom could not log in to BloomLibrary.org using your saved credentials. Please check your network connection.
Sorry, this version of Bloom Desktop is not compatible with the current version of BloomLibrary.org. Please upgrade to a newer version.
Please log in to BloomLibrary.org (or sign up) before uploading
Please set this from the edit tab
trans-unit.note: This shows next to the license, if the license has not yet been set.

trans-unit.source: Suggestion: Assigning a Creative Commons License makes it easy for you to clearly grant certain permissions to everyone.
Suggestion: Creative Commons Licenses make it much easier for others to use your book, even if they aren't fluent in the language of your custom license.

This book seems to be a template, that is, it contains blank pages for authoring a new book rather than content to translate into other languages. If that is not what you intended, you should get expert help before uploading this book.\n\nDo you want to go ahead?
trans-unit.note:
OLD TEXT (before 4.0, mark newlines properly): This book seems to be a template, that is, it contains blank pages for authoring a new book rather than content to translate into other languages. If that is not what you intended, you should get expert help before uploading this book.
Do you want to go ahead?

trans-unit.source: There was a problem uploading your book. This is probably because your computer is set to use the wrong timezone or your system time is badly wrong. See http://www.di-mgt.com.au/wclock/help/wclo_setsysclock.html for how to fix this.
Congratulations, "{0}" is now available on BloomLibrary.org ({1})
There was a problem uploading your book. You may need to restart Bloom or get technical help.

trans-unit.note: In this step, Bloom is uploading things like title, languages, and topic tags to the BloomLibrary.org database.
OLD TEXT (before 3.9): Maximum Words per Book

trans-unit.source: Click on letters to add them to this stage.
Help exporting and converting files to use as sample texts
To help you make decodable readers, Bloom needs to know the letters and letter combinations that you will be teaching.
Separate each letter or letter combination with a space. For example, here is what we might use for the English language:
Notice that the English list includes symbols that are used to make words, like ' in

trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, use literal NBSP character): Level

trans-unit.source: Maximum Average Length of Sentences in Book

trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, reworded): Maximum Unique Words per Book

trans-unit.source: Bloom already knows which characters in the world's languages always mark the end of sentences. To add others, enter the Unicode character escapes here. For example for Thai script languages, enter \U0020 to tell Bloom that normal spaces are used to break sentences.
set up the alphabet for this language.
Things to remember for this level:
To help you make decodable readers, Bloom can suggest words that fit within the current stage. There are two ways to give words to Bloom:
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, added space): To help you make decodable readers, Bloom can suggest words that fit within the current stage. There are two ways to give words to Bloom:

trans-unit.source: We are using lists of allowed words to define stages
We are using letters with sight words to define stages

In addition, this Bloom Pack will carry your latest decodable and leveled reader settings for the "{0}" language. Anyone opening this Bloom Pack, who then opens a "{0}" collection, will have their current decodable and leveled reader settings replaced by the settings in this Bloom Pack. They will also get the current set of words for use in decodable readers.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, remove unwanted backslashes): In addition, this Bloom Pack will carry your latest decodable and leveled reader settings for the \"{0}\" language. Anyone opening this Bloom Pack, who then opens a \"{0}\" collection, will have their current decodable and leveled reader settings replaced by the settings in this Bloom Pack. They will also get the current set of words for use in decodable readers.

trans-unit.source: The following books will be made into templates:
Please take a minute to register {0}
trans-unit.note: Place a {0} where the name of the program goes.
Place a {0} where the name of the program goes.

trans-unit.source: I'm stuck, I'll finish this later.

trans-unit.note: Place a {0} where the name of the program goes.
Shown in the button that closes the dialog after a successful report submission.

trans-unit.source: Bloom was not able to submit your report directly to our server. Please retry or email {0} to {1}.

trans-unit.note: Shown if there was an error submitting the report. Lets the user try submitting it again.

trans-unit.source: See what else will be submitted

trans-unit.note: This is shown while Bloom is sending the problem report to our server.

trans-unit.source: We received your report, thanks for taking the time to help make Bloom better!
What seems to be the problem?

trans-unit.note: This is shown while Bloom is creating the problem report. It's generally too fast to see, unless you include a large book.

trans-unit.source: I get it. Do not show this again.
Please notice the sample printer settings below. Use them as a guide while you set up the printer.
This script is right to left

trans-unit.note: ID: TemplateBooks.BookName.The Moon and the Cap

trans-unit.source: A blank page that allows you to add items.
This page was automatically inserted because the following page is marked as part of a two page spread.
Page with a picture on top and a large, centered word below.

trans-unit.note: This label indicates a page with one arithmetic problem on it.
This label indicates a page with two arithmetic problems on it.
This label indicates a page with three arithmetic problems on it.
This label indicates a page with four arithmetic problems on it.
Caption of 2nd page in books made from Template Starter
Caption of first page in books made from Template Starter
Used in page preview for Comprehension Question pages. Should be short.
ID: TemplateBooks.PageLabel.This Page Is Intentionally Blank
This page type only shows in Edit Mode to give instructions to translators. It does not print.
